text: # Justification Overall, there is low-certainty evidence for the balance of the benefits, harms and cost-effectiveness of using dual-stain cytology as a triage test after positive HPV NAT testing.The longitudinal evidence for the benefits of dual-stain cytology found that, compared with cytology, the risk of pre-cancers after 3–5 years may be lower in women with a negative result on dual-stain cytology, and higher in women who are dual-stain positive.
